title: Flask Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of Flask basics, routing, and core concepts.

questions.question: What is Flask?
options: A lightweight WSGI web application framework
questions.correctAnswer: A lightweight WSGI web application framework
questions.explanation: Flask is a micro web framework for Python that provides the basics for building web applications.

questions.question: How do you define a route in Flask?
questions.explanation: Flask supports multiple ways to define routes: using @app.route decorator, @app.get/@app.post decorators, or add_url_rule method.

questions.question: How do you create a Flask application?
questions.explanation: A Flask application is created by instantiating the Flask class, typically with __name__ as the import name.

questions.question: How do you capture URL variables in Flask?
questions.explanation: Flask uses angle brackets <> for URL variables, and supports converters like int, float, string, etc.

questions.question: What templating engine does Flask use by default?
questions.explanation: Flask uses Jinja2 as its default templating engine for rendering HTML templates.

questions.question: How do you access form data in Flask?
questions.explanation: Form data is accessed through the request.form dictionary in Flask.

questions.question: How do you store data in Flask sessions?
questions.explanation: Flask sessions work like dictionaries and store data on the server side with a session ID in cookies.

questions.question: What is the naming convention for Flask extensions?
questions.explanation: Flask extensions typically follow the naming convention Flask-Something, like Flask-SQLAlchemy or Flask-WTF.

title: Advanced Flask Concepts
description: Explore advanced Flask features including blueprints, extensions, and security.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Flask Blueprints?
options: To organize applications into modules and components
questions.correctAnswer: To organize applications into modules and components
questions.explanation: Blueprints in Flask allow you to organize your application into reusable components and modules.

questions.question: What does Flask-SQLAlchemy provide?
options: Database ORM functionality for Flask applications
questions.correctAnswer: Database ORM functionality for Flask applications
questions.explanation: Flask-SQLAlchemy is an extension that adds SQLAlchemy ORM support to Flask applications.

questions.question: What is Flask-WTF used for?
questions.explanation: Flask-WTF integrates WTForms with Flask, providing form handling, validation, and CSRF protection.

questions.question: How do you protect against CSRF attacks in Flask?
questions.explanation: Flask-WTF provides CSRF protection, Flask-Security offers comprehensive security features, or you can implement manual token checking.

questions.question: How do you write tests for Flask applications?
options: Using unittest with Flask's test client
questions.explanation: Flask supports various testing approaches: unit tests with test client, pytest, and end-to-end testing with Selenium.

questions.question: What WSGI server is commonly used for Flask deployment?
questions.explanation: Gunicorn is a popular WSGI HTTP Server commonly used for deploying Flask applications in production.
